intro: Homalium decurrens, commonly known as the creeping huito, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its elongated, often pendulous leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody, fleshy fruits that are edible. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its attractive foliage and unique fruit structure.
